channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: NASA has delayed the undocking of Boeing's Starliner capsule until next week
item.description: Managers are still troubleshooting a number of thruster issues and helium leaks on the capsule's first crewed flight test.
item.content:encoded: Managers are still troubleshooting a number of thruster issues and helium leaks on the capsule's first crewed flight test.
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: 2 fast-growing wildfires have upended the lives of thousands of people near Ruidoso, N.M.
item.description: The fires are threatening the village of Ruidoso. Tribal, state and federal officials are scrambling to save homes and lives.
item.content:encoded: The fires are threatening the village of Ruidoso. Tribal, state and federal officials are scrambling to save homes and lives.
item.dc:creator: KC Counts

item.title: Does Biden's plan to protect millions from deportation square with border tightening?
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel talks with Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas about the Biden administration's immigration orders.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel talks with Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas about the Biden administration's immigration orders.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Juneteenth isn’t just a Black holiday. It’s for all Americans
item.description: Opal Lee, the activist known as the grandmother of Juneteenth, worked hard to see it become a federal holiday. NPR's Michel Martin reflects on why it's a holiday for all Americans.
item.content:encoded:
Opal Lee, the activist known as the grandmother of Juneteenth, worked hard to see it become a federal holiday. NPR's Michel Martin reflects on why it's a holiday for all Americans.

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Howard Blatt, stroke survivor who co-founded an aphasia support group, died at 88
item.description: After a stroke left Howard Blatt unable to speak, he helped create a support group for other people with aphasia, a brain condition that impairs communication. He recently died at age 88.
item.content:encoded:
After a stroke left Howard Blatt unable to speak, he helped create a support group for other people with aphasia, a brain condition that impairs communication. He recently died at age 88.

(Image credit: Sacha Pfeiffer)
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Appreciating our enslaved ancestors despite the relics of the Confederacy
item.description: Code Switch co-host B.A. Parker on what to do with the debris of Southern sins as we celebrate Juneteenth.
item.content:encoded:
Code Switch co-host B.A. Parker on what to do with the debris of Southern sins as we celebrate Juneteenth.

(Image credit: Dwight Fenner)
item.dc:creator: B.A. Parker

item.title: Poisoned trees gave a wealthy couple a killer view — and united residents in outrage
item.description: A politically connected Missouri couple allegedly poisoned their neighbor's trees to secure their million-dollar view of Camden Harbor in Maine. The incident was unearthed by the victim herself.
item.content:encoded:
A politically connected Missouri couple allegedly poisoned their neighbor's trees to secure their million-dollar view of Camden Harbor in Maine. The incident was unearthed by the victim herself.

(Image credit: Courtesy Vinal Applebee)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Willie Mays, widely considered baseball's best all-around player, dies at 93
item.description: Known as the "Say Hey Kid," Mays' career spanned more than two decades, from the 1950s to 1970s. He spent nearly all of those years with the Giants – first in New York and then in San Francisco.
item.content:encoded: Known as the "Say Hey Kid," Mays' career spanned more than two decades, from the 1950s to 1970s. He spent nearly all of those years with the Giants – first in New York and then in San Francisco.
item.dc:creator: Tom Goldman

item.title: She was sobbing in the hospital hallway — then felt a comforting hand on her shoulder
item.description: In 1996, Lorrie Paul was in the hospital, visiting her ailing father. As she sobbed in the hallway, a kind stranger walked by and offered comfort.
item.content:encoded:
In 1996, Lorrie Paul was in the hospital, visiting her ailing father. As she sobbed in the hallway, a kind stranger walked by and offered comfort.

(Image credit: Lorrie Paul)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: Opinion: Putin and Kim forge closer ties, resuscitating a defunct Stalinist alliance
item.description: As Russia's leader visits North Korea, Johns Hopkins professor Sergey Radchenko offers insights into the fascinating history of twists and turns in relations between Moscow and Pyongyang.
item.content:encoded:
As Russia's leader visits North Korea, Johns Hopkins professor Sergey Radchenko offers insights into the fascinating history of twists and turns in relations between Moscow and Pyongyang.

(Image credit: U.S. Army Signal Corps)
item.dc:creator: Sergey Radchenko
